p: On the other hand, Sr 2AlH 7 decomposes to SrH 2, Al, and H 2 at 290 °C [ 231, 232]. However, attempts to hydrogenate mixtures of 4SrH 2 + 2Al (70 bar, 260 °C, two days) did not succeed. In this last case, stearic acid was used as a process control agent (PCA) to avoid the cold welding of Al during mechanical milling. Possibly, another PCA might lead to successful hydrogenation. Unfortunately, the dehydrogenation curves of Sr 2AlH 7 were not presented in these studies.
